results.title: The Food revolution
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Burton Benjamin, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Explains some of the pilot projects on which scientists are working as they attempt to cope with the problems of food shortage and exploding population in the 21st century. At least one and a half million people are being damaged in body and in mind because they do not have enough to eat. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Computer revolution. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A timely - even frightening - reminder of the rapid advance computers are making into our lives. In many fields the impersonal efficient machine is shaping and controlling our destinies. The film points to the ever-increasing reliance on computers and illustrates computer applications of today and in the future specifically in production, aviation, medicine, education, law-enforcement, rocket space travel, design, communication etc. Implications for citizens’ rights to privacy. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Bats, birds and bionics
results.creator_credit: John MacDonald, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Demonstrates the application of the principles of natural systems in living animals such as bats, rattlesnakes, frogs and rats, to engineering devices to guide blind persons, self guiding missiles, photoelectric scanners capable of distinguishing shapes and bionic computers designed to learn and to control man-like robots. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John MacDonald, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System

group_works.title: [Various women's athletic events from the 1976 Olympic Games]

results.title: Eat,Sleep and Cycle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976 Olympic Films”.
Riders from all over the world competed in this bicycle Marathon from Brisbane to Sydney. All the grit, determination and endurance of the riders is captured in this film. Rated: G

results.title: [Various women's athletic events from the 1976 Olympic Games]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976 Olympic Films”
Shows various women’s events from the 1976 Olympic Games. Includes jumping events - pole vaulting, high jump, long jump and throwing events - shot put, javelin. Also shown are baton relay, running hurdles, endurance events. Silent film.
